channel.title: [VirtualBox] gateway & workstation freezing during inactivity
channel.description:
I'm using Whonix since 8th version, and I've never encountered such problem. When I work on workstation, after couple minutes, my connection is blocked because gateway is freezing itself. Same thing is happening with workstation. When I'm living the computer, after 5 minutes screen saver on the host start working, and when I want to come back to Whonix, both gateway and workstation are blocked.
This is the prompt I get in gateway after freeze:
[ 940.101714] Freezing user space processes ... (elapsed 0.004 seconds) done. [ 940.107747] Freezing remaining freezable tasks ... (elapsed 0.001 secodnds) done. [ 940.110516] Suspending console(s) (use no_console_suspend to debug)
How can I turn it off?
E: Of course I'm talking about Whonix 11.

item.title: [VirtualBox] gateway & workstation freezing during inactivity
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
As long as the desktop is running, you can start…

Then sort by CPU usage. Or memory. Keep looking what uses most or non-ordinary high amounts by comparison.

Also…

Install some tools.

Go to a virtual (text) console. (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Desktop#Virtual_Consoles)

VirtualBox host key + F1 or F2, F3 etc
(right control is default)

Keep looking. See if any processes use and ridiculous amount >= 50% or more.

Also, keep watching syslog.

If it shows anything interesting. Or post the syslog here.

Read full topic

item.title: [VirtualBox] gateway & workstation freezing during inactivity
item.dc:creator: spearmint
item.description:
Which virtualizer?"
VirtualBox 4.3.30 r101610
Which host operating system?
Debian 8.1.0 x64
X, the graphical environment crashes and you're left in the text console?
No, console is not working. It's just a black screen and a prompt that I posted earlier. I need to power off virtual machine to end this error and move on.
If you use your computer actively without inactivity, then Whonix-Gateway works fine for an unlimited amount of time?
No, I need to do something on gateway every ten minutes, to keep it alive. No matter where I'm working (host or workstation).
Did you try to disable the screen saver on the host if it still happens then during inactivity? (I am not suggesting this as a permanent solution. For debugging only.)
Like I said, It freezes even when I working on the host. Just now gateway freeze. With the same prompt as earlier.
Would be worth keeping a process monitor running. And "iotop -a". Eventually monitoring things from tty0. Also check syslog. Do you know about this stuff?
No, please give me some details.

Read full topic

item.title: [VirtualBox] gateway & workstation freezing during inactivity
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
It’s not a wanted feature. It’s either a bug in Whonix, the virtualizer or the host operating system. Therefore there is no obvious way to disable it. Best that can be done is asking questions back and forth. Hoping that way the cause can be debugged. So a workaround can be suggested as quick fix and so the bug might be fixed with an update.

Which virtualizer?

Which host operating system?

X, the graphical environment crashes and you’re left in the text console?

If you use your computer actively without inactivity, then Whonix-Gateway works fine for an unlimited amount of time?

Did you try to disable the screen saver on the host if it still happens then during inactivity? (I am not suggesting this as a permanent solution. For debugging only.)

Would be worth keeping a process monitor running. And “iotop -a”. Eventually monitoring things from tty0. Also check syslog. Do you know about this stuff?
